text:
116 Henry Street, south side, between Pike and Rutgers Street, showing P.S. 2.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.

July 29, 1929.

Pike Street, at the N.W. corner of Henry Street. Also shown is Henry Street, North side, at Pike Street.

July 25, 1931.

P. L. Sperr,

(1) Pike Street , west side, north from but not including Henry, to and including Division Streets. Also shown is 114-116 Division Street, (in the background, north side, between Allen and Orchard Streets.) July 25, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, further north, from and including East Broadway, to and including Division Street. July 25, 1931.

P. L' Sperr.

(3) The same, as No. 2, but at a later date, showing razing of buildings for the widening of Allen Street. September 7, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Pike Street , west side, north from but not including Henry, to and including Division Streets. Also shown is 114-116 Division Street, (in the background, north side, between Allen and Orchard Streets.) July 25, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, further north, from and including East Broadway, to and including Division Street. July 25, 1931.

P. L' Sperr.

(3) The same, as No. 2, but at a later date, showing razing of buildings for the widening of Allen Street. September 7, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Pike and Henry Streets, Manhattan

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code III B-1
March 6, 1936
"Down Park Row frm New Bowery. Joseph Seitz o[f] 27 Pike St. w[ith] dog." July 19, 1941 P. L. Sperr, Photographer Neg. No. A-867
title: Manhattan: Park Row - New Bowery
